item.title: Bash Command Alternatives in PowerShell
item.description: Bash and PowerShell are two popular command-line shells that can help you automate tasks and manage your system. Bash is the default shell for Linux and macOS, while PowerShell is the default shell for Windows.

item.title: Customize Your PowerShell Profile
item.description: Introduction A PowerShell profile is a script that runs every time you start PowerShell and allows you to configure various aspects of your shell environment.

item.title: Fixing PowerShell Remote Console in Devolutions Remote Desktop Manager
item.description: Special Thanks Special thanks to Marc-Andr√© Moreau, whose expertise and assistance on the Devolutions Forum led to this workaround.

item.title: Get Your Public IP Address Using the Terminal
item.description: We get our private IP address using the terminal all the time. I’m sure we’ve all used ipconfig /all in Windows.

item.title: Using the Terminal for Basic Network Troubleshooting
item.description: Introduction Network troubleshooting is a necessary and valuable capability for any IT professional from helpdesk technician to veteran network engineer. In this blog post we will take a look at some basic commands you can use from your terminal (specifically in a Windows environment).

item.title: Working with CSV and XLSX Files in PowerShell
item.description: Introduction PowerShell is a powerful scripting language that can automate a wide variety of tasks. One common activity that IT professionals need to perform is working with data files such as CSV and XLSX files, both of which are typically associated with Microsoft Excel or other workbook/worksheet applications.
